text:
Why the left side hurts and what to do about it
07 Nov 2019, 17:00 by Ekaterina Komissarova, Maria Dronova
Lifehacker collected 16 common causes, including deadly ones.
Let's say right away: pain in the left side is a common thing and most often safe. However, you should not leave it unattended. Sometimes even slight discomfort on the left side can signal serious illness.
When to call an ambulance
Call an ambulance immediately if *: * Source: 15 possible causes of abdominal pain

Acute or dull pain on the left side of the chest gives Symptoms to the left arm. Heart attack, shoulder, jaw.
Tangible pain is accompanied by fever up to 38.8 ¬∞ C and above.
Sudden sharp pain is concentrated at one point and does not stop for several minutes or longer.
My stomach hurts (both on the left and at any other point), and relief comes only when you lie still on your back.
The pain does not subside over time, but, it seems, even intensifies.
She is accompanied by vomiting. The situation is especially threatening if there is blood in the contents of the stomach.
The pain is sharp, it is not possible to urinate.
Stool black or streaked with blood.
The stomach is tense, even the lightest touch is painful.
Lower abdomen - severe pulling or stitching pain, and at the same time you are pregnant or do not exclude this.
Shortly before the onset of severe pain there was a blow to the stomach or ribs.

When you need to go to the doctor faster
Plan a visit to the therapist soon if *: * Source: Abdominal pain

The pain in the left side is insignificant, but it worries regularly, making itself felt a week or longer.
A palpable pain either appears or disappears, and this condition lasts longer than 1-2 days, or is accompanied by nausea and vomiting, or it becomes more painful.
Drawing in the left abdomen is accompanied by a deterioration in appetite, diarrhea that lasts longer than a couple of days, or (for women) bloody vaginal discharge.
In addition to the discomfort in the left side, you notice that you are losing weight for no apparent reason.

Why does the left side hurt?
There are dozens of answers. The stomach, spleen, pancreas, large and small intestines, as well as the left lung and kidney, bladder, uterus and ovaries in women can hurt.
A separate song is a heart that is shifted to the left: failures in its work often make themselves felt by reflected pains in the left side of the body.
However, unpleasant sensations do not always speak of diseases. Here are the most common causes of pain in the left side - both the abdomen * and the hypochondrium. * Source: 15 possible causes of abdominal pain
1. Increased gas formation
When the food we ate and digested in the stomach enters the small intestine, bacteria are taken for its breakdown. In the process, they emit carbon dioxide and other gases. If there are too many gases in the intestines, the pressure rises. Parts of the intestine expand, press on the nerve endings located around it. This causes bloating and pain.
What to do with it
To begin with - find out the cause of flatulence. Most often it is simple: you overeat, lean on fatty foods or, for example, eat too fast, swallowing air. Try revising your diet and eating habits:

eat slower;
chew food thoroughly;
Avoid foods that increase gas production - convenience foods, junk food, cabbage, carrots and so on.

If bloating hurts you regularly, consult a gastroenterologist. Perhaps the problem is in the intestinal microflora: you have bacteria that produce too much gas. In this case, the doctor will prescribe prebiotics that will help normalize the microflora.
2. constipation
Lack of stool can cause discomfort, and sometimes pain in the intestines. The reason * is usually a lack of fiber or fluid. * Source: Constipation
What to do with it
Drink more water and eat fiber-rich foods such as leafy vegetables, whole grain bread, bran, legumes, and solid fruits. You can take a laxative in consultation with a therapist.
If constipation becomes regular, talk to them about the doctor - the same therapist, gastroenterologist or nutritionist. Most likely, you will be asked to review the diet.
3. Strong physical activity
You ran fast or jumped too energetically, swam, and so on. Exercise increases blood flow. If it is excessive, blood overflows the spleen. The organ grows in size and begins to press on its own capsule shell, in which there are nerve endings. So there is the famous "stab in the left side."
By the way, the no less famous ‚Äústab in the right side‚Äù has similar reasons, only the liver is full of blood.
What to do with it
To get rid of the pain in the side caused by physical exertion, it is enough just to slow down and wait until the breathing becomes even.
For the future: do not start an active workout without a warm-up. Try to keep a comfortable pace and do not require extra effort from the body.
4. Pain in the muscles
Maybe they did active twisting in training and overdid it. Maybe they sat in the draft. Or maybe you have poor posture, stress, or an autoimmune disease. Myalgia *, that is, muscle pain, has dozens of causes. * Source: Muscle Pain: Possible Causes
What to do with it
If the pain in the side appeared after exercise or, for example, after you, having sweated, sat under the conditioner, you can simply endure it. To relieve the condition, take an over-the-counter pain medication such as ibuprofen.
But if the unpleasant sensations do not pass 3-4 days, intensify or if you have no idea about their causes, be sure to check with the therapist. The doctor will clarify the diagnosis and prescribe treatment.
5. Injury
For example, they slipped and fell on their left side. Or you were hit in the stomach or in the ribs.
What to do with it
Perhaps you got off with only a slight bruise. Although such injuries cause discomfort, they heal quite quickly on their own.
But if after a stroke you feel severe acute pain, weakness, tinnitus or suspect that a rib may be broken, call an ambulance immediately. Or contact the emergency room if it is nearby.
6. Monthly
During or before menstruation, the lower abdomen may hurt. Including in the left part, sometimes giving in the back.
What to do with it
Menstrual pain, although unpleasant, is not dangerous. It can simply be endured. Or take an over-the-counter pain medication - the same ibuprofen.
Does not help? Yes, unfortunately, this also happens. Contact your gynecologist: the doctor will choose the best painkillers or prescribe hormonal oral contraceptives that reduce discomfort.
7. Endometriosis or ovarian cyst
These diseases can be recognized by pulling pains in the pelvic area - both on the left and on the right. The sensations are similar to menstrual pains, but can occur at any time. Menstruation with such violations lengthens and becomes more painful.
What to do with it
If there is even the slightest suspicion of diseases of the reproductive system, undergo a examination by a gynecologist.
It is important to make the right diagnosis in time, sometimes life depends on it. For example, rupture of a large ovarian cyst can cause uterine bleeding and death from blood loss. Do not take chances.
8. Ectopic pregnancy
An ectopic pregnancy is said to be when a fertilized egg does not attach * to the uterus, but to the fallopian tube, cervix, ovary or other place in the abdominal cavity. Sooner or later, the growing embryo breaks the organ to which it is attached. This can lead to severe bleeding and peritonitis, including death. * Source: Ectopic Pregnancy
What to do with it
If you are pregnant or suspect this, then any acute pain in the lower abdomen, especially if it is accompanied by dizziness, nausea, spotting and does not go away within a few minutes, is a definite reason to call an ambulance.
9. Inflammation of the intestinal mucosa
There are many possible causes of inflammation. Here are the most common ones:

Viral or bacterial infections. They can be obtained by eating something overdue or, for example, by swallowing dirty water.
Food and alcohol poisoning.
Taking antibiotics, especially if you bought them without the consent of your doctor. Recall: Do Not Do It!
Parasites. The same helminth worms.
Various diseases of the gastrointestinal tract - gastritis, pancreatitis, cholecystitis, ulcerative colitis, Crohn's disease, hepatitis.

In addition to pain, inflammatory bowel lesions are accompanied by nausea, prolonged diarrhea or constipation, bloating, and fever.
What to do with it
Consult a gastroenterologist. Treatment depends on the diagnosis, which can only be delivered by a qualified doctor. In some cases - for example, with rotavirus (aka intestinal flu) - it is enough to lie down and observe a drinking regimen. Other situations will require antibiotics or other medications.
10. You have stones or other kidney disease
Urolithiasis, pyelonephritis, other renal disorders manifest themselves as sudden excruciating pain in the lower abdomen. Such pain clearly radiates to the lower back and then intensifies, then weakens.
What to do with it
If you suspect a kidney problem, do not hesitate to visit a nephrologist. The doctor will make an accurate diagnosis and prescribe the necessary medications. In some cases, a surgical operation is needed, and it is in your interests to carry out it quickly.
11. Pneumonia or pleurisy
Pneumonia is inflammation of the lungs, and pleurisy is inflammation of the membrane that surrounds the lungs. Most often, these diseases * are caused by bacteria or viruses. * Source: Upper Left Abdominal Pain
Recognizing lung lesions is not difficult: acute chest pain appears with deep breathing or coughing. Additional symptoms: fever, weakness, chills, difficulty breathing.
What to do with it
If the temperature has risen above 38 ¬∞ C, it is difficult and painful for you to breathe, you constantly cough - you need to urgently call a doctor at home. In other cases, you can get to the therapist yourself.
12. Appendicitis
In most cases, appendi inflammationksa makes itself felt with pain in his right side. However, sometimes pain occurs in the upper left * part of the abdomen. * Source: Acute Appendicitis Presenting as Unusual Left Upper Quadrant Pain
What to do with it
If the causes of dull pain on the left are unknown to you, but at the same time you notice bloating, loss of appetite, and fever, be sure to consult a therapist as soon as possible.
Urgently call an ambulance if other symptoms are added:

growing pain;
vomiting
sharp weakness, cold, sticky sweat;
heart palpitations.

They may indicate that appendicitis has passed into an acute form, that is, the appendix has burst. This condition requires immediate surgical intervention.
13. Aneurysm of the abdominal aorta
The aorta is the main blood vessel in the abdominal cavity that goes down from the heart. When it grows and swells, it is called * aneurysm. This happens mainly in older people, especially smokers. * Source: Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm



Vera Serezhina Senior doctor, medical expert at the LabKvest personalized medicine laboratory.
¬†¬†¬†¬†Aneurysm usually does not have any obvious symptoms. But sometimes pain is felt when an enlarged vessel compresses the internal organs. If rupture of the aneurysm occurs, a person may die from internal bleeding.
What to do with it
At home, it is almost impossible to determine the aortic aneurysm, the diagnosis is established only by computed tomography. Therefore, if you regularly feel dull pain in the abdomen (not so important, left or right), and especially if it is accompanied by a pulsation, go to the therapist. The doctor will direct you to the necessary examinations.
When the aorta ruptures, a person feels a sudden severe pain in the abdomen or from the back. Immediately after this, collapse occurs - a life-threatening condition, when the pressure drops and the blood supply to the organs worsens. In this case, you need to call an ambulance without losing a second.
14. Diverticulitis
Diverticula * are similar to small bulging pouches in the lower part of the colon. They occur in many people over 40 years old and most often do not bother. * Source: Diverticulitis
But sometimes diverticulums become inflamed - this process is called diverticulitis. And in some cases they can break, which entails serious complications: perforation of the intestinal walls, abscess, peritonitis, bowel obstruction ...
What to do with it
If you experience inexplicable pain in the lower left abdomen and especially if it is accompanied by fever, nausea, constipation or diarrhea, be sure to check with your gastroenterologist. If diverticulitis is confirmed, you will be prescribed antibiotics and pain medication. In some cases, surgery may be required.
15. Heart problems
Pain - sharp or dull - in the left side can cause various heart disorders, from angina to heart attack.
What to do with it
If you are regularly disturbed by pains in the left hypochondrium, extending to the shoulder or arm, in no case do not leave them unattended. Be sure to consult with a therapist at least, or consult a cardiologist right away.
Sharp pain in the left hypochondrium, accompanied by weakness, breathing problems, abdominal pain, arrhythmia, is an unambiguous indication for calling an ambulance immediately. We can talk about a heart attack, and then every second counts.
16. One type of cancer
Unfortunately, cancer of the intestine, stomach, pancreas in the initial stages almost does not make itself felt. They can be seen except for some discomfort in the abdomen, mild symptoms of digestive disorders, inexplicable weight loss.
What to do with it
Be attentive to any incomprehensible sensations in the left side (however, not only in the left). If they become regular, be sure to consult a physician or gastroenterologist and go through all the examinations they have prescribed.
